channel.title: How to make a 667/704 webclient UPDATED
channel.description:
hello and welcome to my second tutorial on how to make webclient
some information: Jar maker download http://download.cnet.com/JAR-Maker/3001-2213_4-10588876.html?spi=52e0595421cf... here .html file download http://project-nex.com/client.txt here save it as client.html!!!!!!
you will need those!
ok, second: when installed the jar maker, run it and select output directory ( where ur .jar will be when u jarred ur client) third: select input directory ( place where your client is, the bin folder!!) fourth: call it client, right next to the ... where will stand something like application.jar, remove it and put there: client fifth: select manifest template, at 704 it will be: Loader (yes with capital) sixt: click Create Jar! seventh: click Jar signer in the middle eight: select jar signer location this will be located at: c:/program files/java/bin/jarsigner.exe (i guess) nine: generate keystore,
will look like this: [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/49546433/generate%20keystore.png[/img] what there is: ppp as keystore alias 1234567 as private key 123456 as public key
output keystore file is where your keystore file will be located after generating keytool location is where your keytool.exe is located most likely: [code]c:/program files/java/bin/keytool.exe[/code]
now add all the details like here: [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/49546433/jarmaker.png[/img]
10th: click Sign Jar!
and now you are done with the .jar
Upload it, the best to use is dropbox, here is how to upload with dropbox: 1. go to http://dropbox.com 2. sign up, in the right corner there is a little button with: sign in, click on it and click on create an account 3. then login, and click on the upload button 4. select your client.jar 5. upload
now we will start with making the html file :)
fill this in: [code] <html> <body> <body bgcolor="black"> <title>Project-Nex webclient</title> <applet name=client width=100% height=100% archive='dl link' code='Loader.class'> </applet> </body> </html>
[/code]
now save it as a .html file
some media: [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oyMnwemtrCM[/youtube]
now upload your client.html to your site, i prefer using 000webhost.com because of it's easy use
[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/49546433/000webhost.png[/img]
and then go to ur cpanel, upload ur .html file and done!
i hope i helped u guys out!
questions about this? ask!

item.title: How to make a 667/704 webclient UPDATED
item.dc:creator: @Rhylek Rhylek
item.description:
@Rhylek wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:439751”][quote author=mickie456 link=topic=542443.msg3996421#msg3996421 date=1337333888]

Mine says: http://gyazo.com/3007ae83b396387985335c151c8af802 when i try to play it as a regular .jar

Then you did something wrong to lose where the loader.class is.
And I believe loader.class is lowercase now uppercase.

Btw: the only difference between a 667/7xx+ webclient and a 317 webclient is what file it’s looking for.
317 - client.class
677/7xx+ - loader.class.

667/7xx = Loader.class
317 = client.class
637 = RunClient.class

if u don’t know what ur main class is, go to ur client folders, right click run.bat
click edit, go to the very right and the last word at the right is ur main class

it would be this with a 667

@echo off @title Project-Nex Client "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -Dfile.encoding=Cp1252 -classpath bin;lib/libs.jar;lib/graphics.jar; Loader pause

so it would be Loader

if u still dont know how to just post or pm or skype: mickie6503

My fricking point. There is NO need for yet another tutorial on “How to make a webclient”

i made this on: April 15, 2012, 04:16:12 PM
[/quote]

And people were still replying to it after that.
What’s your point on the day it’s made?
I didn’t grave dig.
Just admit that this tutorial is worthless. Seeing as anyone could type in “webclient” in the search bar for this section and you’d get hundreds of results, some being asking for help, but most (in this section.) would be tutorials.
Do you understand why I say this tut is worthless.
You just change 1 word in the JARmaker.jar and it is the webclient tutorial for everyone using 667+

Oh by the way, you can make that stupid client.html in 5 seconds using JARmaker.jar. See that think that says “Applet HTML” in the JARmaker? Yeah that can make the html for you. Not so hard.
Thank you for making another useless thread.[/quote]

Dude your just being a doosh. Its a helpful tutorial and people obviously read it. If it was so easy you wouldnt have looked up how to do it. admit YOUR worthless

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a 667/704 webclient UPDATED

Then you did something wrong to lose where the loader.class is.
And I believe loader.class is lowercase now uppercase.

Btw: the only difference between a 667/7xx+ webclient and a 317 webclient is what file it’s looking for.
317 - client.class
677/7xx+ - loader.class.

667/7xx = Loader.class
317 = client.class
637 = RunClient.class

if u don’t know what ur main class is, go to ur client folders, right click run.bat
click edit, go to the very right and the last word at the right is ur main class

it would be this with a 667

@echo off @title Project-Nex Client "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -Dfile.encoding=Cp1252 -classpath bin;lib/libs.jar;lib/graphics.jar; Loader pause

so it would be Loader

if u still dont know how to just post or pm or skype: mickie6503

My fricking point. There is NO need for yet another tutorial on “How to make a webclient”
[/quote]

i made this on: April 15, 2012, 04:16:12 PM[/quote]

And people were still replying to it after that.
What’s your point on the day it’s made?
I didn’t grave dig.
Just admit that this tutorial is worthless. Seeing as anyone could type in “webclient” in the search bar for this section and you’d get hundreds of results, some being asking for help, but most (in this section.) would be tutorials.
Do you understand why I say this tut is worthless.
You just change 1 word in the JARmaker.jar and it is the webclient tutorial for everyone using 667+

Oh by the way, you can make that stupid client.html in 5 seconds using JARmaker.jar. See that think that says “Applet HTML” in the JARmaker? Yeah that can make the html for you. Not so hard.
Thank you for making another useless thread.
